result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Gonzalez II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges due by September 6, 2023. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Court orders bail to be applied and any remainder return to posting party.
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael E Gonzalez II

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Colin McGinn

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 81 days served. 


Provide a DNA sample. 


Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges due by September 6, 2023. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Court orders bail to be applied and any remainder return to posting party.

Court set restitution at zero.

Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 


Filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Michael E Gonzalez II in court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Michael E Gonzalez II.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Michael E Gonzalez in court, appeared by video with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn, appeared in person.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared in personb for Gerald Alder for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for final pretrial conference.   
Case remains in trial posture. Court addresses the parties pretrial documents. Court advised by the parties there are no remaining issues to address before trial date.  Jury trial remains calendared on 09/06/2022 at 9:00am, Branch 2.
Turnover to Justice Point for level 5 supervision with all previously ordered conditions of bail.

Defendant Michael E Gonzalez in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Michael E Gonzalez in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for final pretrial. For reasons stated, State requests an adjourned jury trial date. Arguments heard as to bail. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial, filed by the State

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Michael E Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Michael E Gonzalez in court, defendant in custody with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appear by video. Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Michael E. Gonzalez II, House of Correction - Pod M6/51, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Michael E Gonzalez not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is set for preliminary hearing.  State's witness is present. SPD did not appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VMG

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring for no contact order monitoring only. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $ 2,500.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Michael E Gonzalez in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
